summary: the 2014/2015 outbreak resulted in more than 28,000 cases and 11,323 reported deaths, as of March 2016. domestic transmission of the Guinea strain associated with the outbreak occurred mainly in six African countries. a further fifteen countries in Africa are predicted to be at risk of Ebolavirus outbreaks in the future. the assay had a detection limit of 134 copies per L of plasmid containing the NP gene of Ebolavirus Mayinga. it was highly specific for the Zaire ebolavirus species, including the Guinea strain responsible for the 2014/2015 outbreak.
